Source code for maxairesources.cleaning.NoiseRemoval

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from pyspark.sql.functions import to_timestamp, date_format,to_utc_timestamp
from functools import reduce
from pyspark.mllib.stat import Statistics
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, isnan, when, count
from maxairesources.logging.logger import get_logger
import json
logger = get_logger(__name__)


[docs]class NoiseRemoval():
    def __init__(self, df, columns, path = ''):
        self.df = df
        self.config_path = path
        self.columns = columns,
        self.treat_cols = columns["numerical_cols"]
        self.date_cols = columns["date_cols"]
        



[docs]    def determine_outlier_thersholds_std(self, col_name):
        df_new = self.df.toPandas()
        upper_boundary = df_new[col_name].mean() + 3* df_new[col_name].std()
        lower_boundary = df_new[col_name].mean()- 3* df_new[col_name].std()
        del df_new
        return lower_boundary, upper_boundary




[docs]    def determine_outlier_thresholds_iqr(self, column):
        less_q1 = "less_Q1_{}".format(column)
        more_q3 = "more_Q3_{}".format(column)
        q1 = "Q1_{}".format(column)
        q3 = "Q3_{}".format(column)

        # Q1 : First Quartile ., Q3 : Third Quartile
        q1 = self.df.approxQuantile(column, [0.25], relativeError=0)
        q3 = self.df.approxQuantile(column, [0.75], relativeError=0)
        iqr = q3[0] - q1[0]

        # selecting the data, with -1.5*IQR to + 1.5*IQR., where param = 1.5 default value
        less_q1 = q1[0] - 1.5 * iqr
        more_q3 = q3[0] + 1.5 * iqr
        return less_q1, more_q3





[docs]    def outlier_detect(self, column, method = "iqr"):
        df_temp = self.df
        if method == "std":
            lower_limit, upper_limit = self.determine_outlier_thersholds_std(column)
        elif method == "iqr":
            lower_limit, upper_limit = self.determine_outlier_thresholds_iqr(column)

        if lower_limit < 0 :
            df_temp = df_temp.withColumn(column, F.when(df_temp[column] > upper_limit, upper_limit).otherwise(df_temp[column]))
        else:
            df_temp = df_temp.withColumn(column, F.when(df_temp[column] < lower_limit, lower_limit).otherwise(df_temp[column]))
            df_temp = df_temp.withColumn(column, F.when(df_temp[column] > upper_limit, upper_limit).otherwise(df_temp[column]))
        self.df = df_temp
        del df_temp 
        return self.df 

    

[docs]    def read_config(self):
        try:
            f= open(self.config_path)  
            report = json.load(f)
        except Exception as e:
            logger.warning("Json File Missing")
            raise Exception("Unable to load data from json file")
        return report

    

[docs]    def remove_outlier(self):
        '''
        remove_outlier: method is used to remove the outliers from the dataset

        input : Dataframe, Numerical Column list
        Approach : We are reading the config file generated from the datacheck module and 
        based on the outlier percentages and skewness of the featues, we are capping outliers based on IQR Range or Standard Deviation Method
        return : Return the processed dataframe which is free from outliers
        '''

        logger.info("Removing outlier has started")
        
        report = self.read_config()
                
        for i in self.treat_cols:
            if "outlier_percentage" in report[i]:
                if report[i]["outlier_percentage"] > 0.0:
                    logger.info("Feature {} needs treatment".format(i))
                    ## Check the skewness and then Treat Outlier
                    if report[i]["skewness_type"] == "approximately symmetrical":
                        logger.info("Feature {} is treated using Standard Deviation".format(i))
                        self.df = self.outlier_detect(column = i, method = "std")
                        logger.info("Feature {} is treated".format(i))
                    else:
                        logger.info("Feature {} is treated using IQR Range".format(i))
                        self.df = self.outlier_detect(column = i, method = "iqr")
                        logger.info("Feature {} is treated".format(i))
        logger.info("Data is free from outliers")
        return self.df

    

[docs]    def impute_null(self):
        '''
        impute_null: method is used to remove the null values from the dataset

        input : Dataframe, Numerical Column list
        Approach : We are reading the config file generated from the datacheck module and 
        based on the null percentages and skewness of the featues, we are imputing null values.
        Skewness type : Symmetrical, Imputation Method - Mean
        Skewness type : Asymmetrical, Imputation Method - Median
        Return : Processed Dataframe free from Null Values
        '''

        logger.info("Null Imputation has started")
        skew_dict = {}
        mean_dict = {}
        median_dict = {}
        report = self.read_config()
        for i in self.treat_cols:
            if report[i]['skewness_type'] == "approximately symmetrical":
                mean_dict[i] = report[i]['mean']
            else:
                median_dict[i] = self.df.stat.approxQuantile(i, [0.5], 0.001)[0]
        logger.info("Features with Mean Imputation : {}".format(mean_dict))
        self.df = self.df.fillna(mean_dict)
        logger.info("Mean Imputation Completed for features: {}".format(mean_dict))
        logger.info("Features with Median Imputation : {}".format(mean_dict))
        self.df = self.df.fillna(median_dict)
        logger.info("Median Imputation Completed for features: {}".format(mean_dict))
        del mean_dict, median_dict, skew_dict
        logger.info("Data is free from NULL values")
        return self.df

    

[docs]    def convert_timeformat(self):
        '''
        convert_timeformat: method is used to convert the timeformat to UTC for all date columns from the dataset

        input : Dataframe, Date Column list
        Approach : 
        Return : Processed Dataframe with all date columns of type timestamp in UTC format
        '''
        
        logger.info("Datetime Conversion [UTC Format] for features : {}".format(self.date_cols))
        self.df = (reduce(
            lambda temp_df, col_name: temp_df.withColumn(col_name,
                to_utc_timestamp(col_name, "UTC")),
            self.date_cols,
            self.df
        ))
        logger.info("Datetime Conversion [UTC Format] for features completed: {}".format(self.date_cols))
        return self.df

    

[docs]    def drop_duplicates(self):
        '''
        drop_duplicates: method is used to drop duplicates rows from the dataset

        input : Dataframe
        Approach : 
        Return : Processed Dataframe with no duplicate rows.
        '''
        
        logger.info("Dropping Duplicates Started")
        logger.info("Size of Data : {}".format(self.df.count()))
        self.df = self.df.dropDuplicates()
        logger.info("Size of data post dropping duplicates : {}".format(self.df.count()))
        return self.df
